item.description: <p>Police alleged Papalii was behaving aggressively towards staff after being asked to leave the leagues club in Canberra&#x27;s north during the early hours after a night of drinking.</p>

item.title: More than $2.3 million in illicit tobacco seized in northern NSW
item.description: <p>F﻿our people remain before the courts after a multi-day operation in the town of Mullumbimby.</p>

item.title: Prince Andrew to lose 'prince' title and move out of the royal lodge, Buckingham Palace confirms
item.description: <p>&quot;Today, an ordinary American girl from an ordinary American family, brought down a British prince.&quot;</p>

item.title: Rapist former MP jailed after sexually assaulting men
item.description: <p>Former Kiama state MP Gareth Ward was found guilty of sexual intercourse without consent and three indecent assaults in July following a NSW District Court trial.</p>

item.title: Heartbroken dad says late son would be 'stoked' with touching cricket tributes
item.description: <p>Australia&#x27;s top cricketers have taken part in a touching tribute to Ben Austin, the 17-year-old who died following a tragic training mishap in the nets earlier this week.</p>

item.title: BoM backflips on controversial rain radar on new website
item.description: <p>Instead of showing the &quot;rain rate&quot; in millimetres per hour, the radar will now go back to showing &quot;rain reflectivity&quot;, which was what was standard on the old website.</p>

item.title: Accused murderer to stand trial after teen's body found at rubbish tip
item.description: <p>An accused murderer has been committed to stand trial over the death of a woman whose body was later found at a rubbish tip.</p>

item.title: Cheers as historic treaty with First Nations people passes Victorian parliament
item.description: <p>Victoria has become the first state in the nation to legislate a treaty with its Indigenous people.</p>

item.title: 'Deeply devastating': Community mourns five-year-old girl killed in crash outside Sydney primary school
item.description: <p>Floral tributes have been laid outside of a primary school in Sydney&#x27;s north-west after a child was hit by a ute coming out of a driveway yesterday afternoon.</p>

item.title: New 'chill out zone' at Burleigh Heads to keep youth safe
item.description: <p>A new youth checkpoint, similar to those implemented during Schoolies celebrations, has been established in Burleigh Heads.</p>

item.title: Qantas resumes international flights to Adelaide after more than a decade
item.description: <p>Adelaide Airport has marked the resumption of international Qantas flights after more than a decade, with the inaugural Adelaide to Auckland service departing this morning. </p>

item.title: Snowtown killer's parole appeal hearing to be heard in secret
item.description: <p>A date has been set for a hearing on a bid to block the youngest Snowtown serial killer from being released on parole, but it will be shrouded in secrecy.</p>

item.title: No sign of missing four-year-old after police drain large dam in renewed search
item.description: <p>Police have drained a large dam on the remote SA homestead where Gus Lamont vanished just over a month ago.</p>

item.title: Woman arrested after tyres slashed on dozens of cars on southern Gold Coast
item.description: <p>Parked cars between Palm Beach, Currumbin, Kirra, Bilinga and Coolangatta had tyres slashed at some time between 9pm last night and 6am this morning, police have confirmed.</p>

item.title: 'Taken away in a minute': Family, community in shock after woman killed in lightning strike
item.description: <p>P﻿aramedics were called to Mary River Road in Cooroy after the lightning strike outside a sporting complex.</p>

item.title: Severe storm warnings for Ipswich, Lockyer and Sunshine Coast
item.description: <p>S﻿outh-east Queensland and northern New South Wales will be in the firing line of severe thunderstorms throughout this afternoon and tomorrow, with the potential to develop isolated tornadoes over the next 24 hours.</p>

item.title: Royal prerogative: King Charles III banishes Andrew to buttress the House of Windsor's foundations
item.description: <p>No one is bigger than the monarchy. Not even the King&#x27;s brother. In the end, that reality spelled the end of Andrew&#x27;s life as a prince of the realm.</p>

item.title: Investigation into police actions under way after motorcyclist hospitalised in NSW Hunter region
item.description: <p>T﻿he 28-year-old remains in hospital today and is expected to be downgraded from a serious condition this afternoon.﻿</p>

item.title: Politicians demand Andrew be questioned after being swiftly removed from Roll of Peerage
item.description: <p>Pressure has now turned to having the royal answer to UK parliament, while others are calling for him to be questioned in the US by the FBI on his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.</p>

item.title: Today in History - November 1: Failed actress turned dictator's wife takes revenge on star who outshone her
item.description: <p>When <em>Blood on Wolf Mountain</em> was released in Chinese cinemas on November 1, 1936, it wasn&#x27;t seen as the sort of movie to have a lasting impact.</p>

item.title: A $7.9 billion bulk billing overhaul has just hit Medicare. This is how it impacts you
item.description: <p>Many Australians will enjoy cheaper visits to the doctor from this weekend, when a $7.9 billion overhaul of the bulk billing system comes into effect.</p>

item.description: The latest explainers, news, videos and analysis from 9News. We explain everything you need to know about the world today.

item.title: Are Christmas advertising and promotions getting earlier each year?
item.description: <p>It&#x27;s beginning to look a lot like Christmas earlier and earlier every year.</p>

item.title: From beaches to ski slopes, how cameras keep watch all over China
item.description: <p>T﻿he communist government has rolled out high-tech surveillance projects aimed at bringing the entire country under round-the-clock watch.</p>

item.title: Man charged with multiple alleged peep and pry offences in Sydney's Inner West
item.description: <p>A 64-year-old man was arrested and charged with seven counts of peep and pry.</p>

item.title: 'There's a cost in getting it wrong': Questions raised about the shaky science behind shaken baby syndrome
item.description: <p>Questions have been raised around the world but here in Australia, ﻿there&#x27;s been &quot;no conversation about it at all&quot; – until now. </p>

item.title: Melbourne man allegedly fell asleep at the wheel at drive-through before blowing three times the legal alcohol
item.description: <p>It is alleged that the driver provided a breath test reading of .158, more than three times the legal prescribed concentration of alcohol.</p>

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: <p>Witnesses have reported fighters going house-to-house, killing civilians and committing sexual assaults.</p>

item.title: Western Australian woman sentenced to decade behind bars for child abuse offences
item.description: <p>T﻿he 24-year-old woman will be eligible for parole after serving eight years.</p>

item.title: China's Xi in the limelight at Pacific summit with Trump conspicuous by his absence
item.description: <p>The US president flew out of South Korea Thursday, choosing to skip the annual summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation.</p>

item.title: Two federal judges require Trump administration to use emergency funds to partially cover food stamp benefits
item.description: <p>The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, or SNAP, costs between $12.2 billion and $13.8 billion a month, so the judges&#x27; orders will not cover all of the needed payments for November.</p>

item.title: 'Threat to Australia's national security': WA brothers front court over illicit tobacco seizure allegedly link
item.description: <p>The Australian Federal Police (AFP) uncovered more than five tonnes of illicit tobacco products they say are linked to a national organised crime syndicate.</p>

item.title: Beers recalled over fears cans could 'burst' and cause injury
item.description: <p>A popular Aussie beer has been recalled over fears cans could burst and cause injury.</p>

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: <p>Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested on Friday in Michigan, USA FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post.</p>

item.title: Melbourne teen injured in street fight as families celebrate Halloween
item.description: <p>A 14-year-old boy has been injured in a fight that erupted as families celebrated Halloween on a residential street in Melbourne&#x27;s west.</p>

item.title: Dramatic rescue of rock climber after getting tangled in ropes 10 metres from the ground
item.description: <p>Emergency services were called to the Onkaparinga River National Park around 12.30pm when a man became tangled in his climbing ropes around 10 metres from the ground.</p>

item.title: 'Morons': Flares thrown into crowd at first Oasis gig in Melbourne
item.description: <p>O﻿asis singer Liam Gallagher has called out a fan who threw flares at the British band&#x27;s first concert in Australia.</p>

item.title: Man arrested after woman found dead in Hunter Valley home
item.description: <p>Officers say a young child raised the alarm after running 400 metres to flag down passersby following the alleged attack.﻿</p>

item.description: <p>Police said the 15-year-old rider hit a raised pedestrian walkway before striking two poles, the impact throwing him 10 metres.</p>
